description:
We are looking for Data Engineers with a solid foundation in data analysis who are eager to upskill in Microsoft Fabric, the next-generation tool for data analytics! We provide comprehensive training materials and cover the certification exam voucher to help you advance your career.

Familiarity or experience with Microsoft Fabric is a plus, but not required.
 
As part of this role, you will:
Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues within Microsoft Fabric.
Collaborate directly with end customers to provide solutions and ensure issue mitigation.
Core Skills and experience:
3-6 years of experience in creating and processing datasets and data models to support data aggregation.
2+ years in technical support or technical consulting roles.
3+ years of experience in data analytics or data engineering, with proficiency in at least two of the following:
Synapse Analytics
Data orchestration (e.g., Synapse or Azure Data Factory)
SQL Server Analysis Services (modeling)
SQL development (e.g., SQL Server, Oracle, Teradata)
Big Data tools (e.g., Databricks, Hadoop, Data Lake)

description:
Client & Project:  The project is for THE WEIR GROUP PLC, a leading provider of engineering solutions for the mining industry.
Overview: The SAP FICO Support Specialist is responsible for providing functional and technical support for SAP FICO (Financial Accounting and Controlling) modules, ensuring accurate financial data, system stability, and continuous improvement of financial and controlling processes. This role involves troubleshooting issues, configuring settings, assisting end-users, and supporting finance and accounting teams to maximize the efficiency of the SAP FICO system. The position requires close collaboration with IT and finance departments to address system requirements and business needs.

Responsibilities:
Incident & Issue Management

Provide first-level support for SAP FICO-related incidents, troubleshooting issues across financial accounting (FI) and controlling (CO) modules.
Conduct root cause analysis for issues related to general ledger, accounts payable, accounts receivable, asset accounting, and controlling functionalities.
Document, resolve, and track recurring issues, escalating to higher levels of support or development teams as needed.
System Configuration & Maintenance

Support the configuration and customization of SAP FICO modules to align with business requirements.
Implement enhancements and perform system testing for any changes to the SAP FICO environment, ensuring seamless functionality.
Assist in SAP upgrades, patches, and migrations, performing necessary testing and validation for smooth transitions.
End-User Support & Training

Serve as the point of contact for finance and accounting users, providing guidance and troubleshooting assistance for SAP FICO functionality.
Develop and deliver training sessions or materials to enhance end-user proficiency in SAP FICO.
Maintain user documentation, guides, and FAQs to support day-to-day operations.
Financial Data Management & Reporting

Ensure data accuracy within SAP FICO, monitoring and validating financial records to support reporting requirements.
Generate financial reports and analysis to assist in decision-making processes and strategic planning.
Support month-end, quarter-end, and year-end closing processes by ensuring SAP FICO systems run smoothly and data is accurate.
Process Optimization & Collaboration

Identify opportunities to improve finance and controlling processes within the SAP FICO system, proposing enhancements to optimize performance.
Work with finance and accounting departments to assess new requirements, capturing and translating business needs into technical specifications.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT and SAP developers, to support integrations with other SAP modules (e.g., SAP MM, SAP SD).
Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Information Technology, or a related field.
Minimum of 2 years of experience in SAP FICO support or similar role within financial systems.
Proficiency in SAP FICO configuration and customization, with a solid understanding of core finance processes.
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to perform root cause analysis and resolve issues effectively.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to interact with end-users and finance stakeholders.
Detail-oriented, able to maintain accuracy and completeness of financial data.
Preferred Skills:

Knowledge of integration points between SAP FICO and other SAP modules, such as SAP MM and SAP SD.
Familiarity with SAP S/4HANA, SAP BW, or SAP BI for reporting and analytics.
SAP certification in Financial Accounting (FI) or Controlling (CO) modules.
Key Competencies:

Proactive problem-solving skills and a customer-service orientation to support end-users effectively.
Adaptability and resilience to manage changing priorities in a fast-paced support environment.
Strong organizational and time-management skills to handle multiple incidents and tasks simultaneously.

description:
MFS is seeking proposals from qualified vendors to provide four QA Automation Leads/Architects to join the Delivery Capabilities QA Automation Team.  We are seeking both Java (Selenium and RestAssured) and Python (TestComplete) specialists.
The Delivery Capabilities QA Automation Team's mission is to create cutting-edge QA automation solutions that enhance the efficiency, reliability, and speed of the software development lifecycle.  This includes continual improvements for scrum teams to develop, run and analyze test suites.  This includes ease of use and lowering the overall cost of automation ownership.
Current Team Responsibilities:
	Automation Framework Enhancements: Expand upon our Java and Python capabilities for our open-source tools and home-grown solutions.  This includes integrating new 3rd party libraries and upgrading existing libraries and methods as needs arise.
	Skills Development: Continuously evolve the team's expertise in AI, Java, Python, Observability, CI/CD/CT, and QA automation tools.
	Tool Selection: Regularly assess and integrate the most effective open-source tools, libraries, and commercial QA tools.  This includes evaluating the latest AI solutions available.
	Continuous Improvement: Seek feedback and implement iterative improvements to our automation strategies and processes.  This includes our Automated QA Sign Off process and execution, maintenance, and time to analyze.
	Keep the Lights On:  Develop and maintain shared code for teams, manage the QA Jenkins platform including individual server configuration, capabilities, and upgrades.  Empower less experienced automation professionals.

Scope of Work:
In addition to the above responsibilities the QA Automation Leads/Architect will embrace an internal consulting role, working closely with scrum teams to evaluate, make suggestions, and assist in the implementation of those suggestions.  Responsibilities include:
	Work with each portfolio team to understand their needs. Make sure teams are taking advantage of automation capabilities that exist, and work with teams to optimize the script development, maintenance, and analysis efforts.
	Drill down and take a critical look at how the team is coding.  This will include making sure teams are actively following coding standards.  This might mean that we take over pull request reviews in Bitbucket for a period.  As an example. hard-coded XPath locators in Selenium have snuck in the code over the past year+ and we want to coach and prevent those things from happening.

Microsoft Teams Voice Solution & Skype for Business  Enigneer -
